law.catch_line: There are four regional advisory boards of the Office....

text.section: There are four regional advisory boards of the Office.
Each regional advisory board consists of five members appointed by the Governor.

Each member of a regional advisory board shall be:
a resident of a district represented by that regional advisory board; and
a judge of a circuit court;
a judge of the District Court; or
an active attorney admitted to practice before the Court of Appeals of Maryland.

section.section: The term of a member of a regional advisory board is 3 years.
A vacancy occurring on a regional advisory board during the term of a member shall be filled by the Governor for the remainder of the unexpired term.
The Governor shall annually designate a chair of each regional advisory board from among the members of that regional advisory board.
The chair shall preside over and represent the interests of that regional advisory board in carrying out this title.

text.section: Three members of a regional advisory board are a quorum.

section.section: Each regional advisory board shall hold at least one regular annual meeting at a time and place that the chair designates.

text.section:
A member of a regional advisory board:
may not receive compensation for serving on the regional advisory board; but
is entitled to reimbursement for expenses under the Standard State Travel Regulations, as provided in the State budget.
